channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: SpaceX repeatedly polluted waters in Texas this year, regulators found
item.description: SpaceX violated environmental regulations in releasing pollutants into or nearby bodies of water in Texas, a state environmental agency found.

item.title: An earthquake with a magnitude of 4.4 has struck the Los Angeles area, the USGS says
item.description: An earthquake with a magnitude of 4.4 has struck the Los Angeles area, the U.S. Geological Service said Monday.

item.title: 10-, 30-year Treasury yields finish lower for second day as Israeli military goes on high alert
item.description: Yields on U.S. government debt closed lower on Monday as traders watched the latest developments in the Middle East and looked ahead to a busy week of U.S. economic updates.

item.title: EU warns Elon Musk ahead of Trump interview to keep hate speech off X
item.description: European Commissioner Thierry Breton warned X owner Elon Musk the company may face penalties if it doesn‚Äôt address the spread of illegal and dangerous content.

item.title: SpaceX repeatedly polluted waters in Texas this year, regulators found
item.description: SpaceX violated environmental regulations in releasing pollutants into or nearby bodies of water in Texas, a state environmental agency found.

item.title: How Robinhood can win a bigger piece of the $65 trillion pie of investable assets
item.description: Piper Sandler sees Robinhood as well positioned to benefit from the generational wealth transfer ‚Äî and a new web platform that could broaden its appeal.

item.title: Trump returns to X ahead of Elon Musk interview, weighing down Trump Media stock
item.description: Donald Trump announced the interview with Elon Musk on Truth Social last week.

item.title: What history says could happen next after volatility roiled the stock market
item.description: Rising volatility in the stock market could potentially trigger a ‚Äúregime‚Äù change in market sentiment, says one analyst.

item.title: Three-year inflation outlook hits record low in New York Fed consumer survey
item.description: Consumers grew more confident in July that inflation will be less of a problem in the coming years.

item.title: S&P 500 may struggle in the next two months, according to history of past volatility spikes
item.description: Bank of America found that the S&P 500 typically is lower two months after the Cboe Volatility Index (VIX) spikes above 45.

item.title: Don‚Äôt expect inflation to take a turn for the worse in PPI and CPI reports
item.description: The rate of inflation probably rose a bit faster in July than in June, but not enough to set off alarm bells or alter a clear slowdown in price increases. The Federal Reserve is likely to remain on track to cut interest rates next month.

item.title: Trump promotes false Harris AI crowd size conspiracy
item.description: Donald Trump has so far held one rally in August, compared with Kamala Harris' busy swing of travel to battleground states over the past week.

item.title: Putin vows 'worthy response' to Ukraine's incursion as 11,000 evacuated in second border region
item.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin vowed a "worthy response" to Ukraine's ongoing incursion into Russian territory.
